intro: Glaucium flavum var. plenum, commonly known as the full-flowered yellow hound's tongue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe. It features striking, yellow, spurred flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has dark green, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique flower structure and vibrant color.
